message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
public void doGet(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response) throws ServletException, IOException {        
    try {            
        PrintWriter writer = response.getWriter();
        writer.write("FieldName");
        writer.write(',');
        writer.write("Value");
        writer.write('\n');
        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")            
        Enumeration <String> paramNames = request.getParameterNames();            
        while(paramNames.hasMoreElements()) {                
            String paramName = (String)paramNames.nextElement();                
            writer.write(paramName);
            writer.write(',');
            String[] paramValues = request.getParameterValues(paramName);                
            if (paramValues.length == 1) {                    
                String paramValue = paramValues[0];                    
                if (paramValue.length() == 0) {                        
                    writer.write("No Value");
                    writer.write('\n');                    
                } else {                        
                    writer.write(paramValue);
                    writer.write('\n');                    
                }                
            } else {                    
                for(int i = 0; i<paramValues.length; i++) {                        
                    writer.write(paramValues[i]);
                    writer.write(',');                    
                }                    
                writer.write('\n');                
            }            
        }            
        writer.flush();            
    } catch(IOException e) {             
        e.printStackTrace();        
    }    
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The PrintWriter.write method is used to write characters to the output stream. In this case, it is used to write the field names and values of the parameters from the HttpServletRequest object to the HttpServletResponse object. The PrintWriter object is obtained from the HttpServletResponse object using the getWriter method. The write method is then used to write the field names and values to the output stream. The flush method is called to ensure that all the data is written out to the output stream.

               String[] paramValues = request.getParameterValues(paramName);                if (paramValues.length == 1)                {                    String paramValue = paramValues[0];                    if (paramValue.length() == 0)                    {                        writer.append("No Value");                        writer.append('\n');                    }                    else                    {                        writer.append(paramValue);                        writer.append('\n');                    }                }                else                {                    for(int i = 0; i<paramValues.length; i++)                    {                        writer.append(paramValues[i]);                        writer.append(',');                    }                    writer.append('\n');                }            }            writer.flush();            writer.close();        }        catch(IOException e)        {             e.printStackTrace();        }    }}
